review: Cymbalta (duloxetine):Cymbalta made me really sick when I started taking it. My teeth were grinding, I was always shaking. Constant nausea. After the nausea cleared I retained the other symptoms and they didn't go away until I discontinued use after 5 months. During the 5 months I was on the medication I did have a drop in my pain levels, however I had so many bad side effects I couldn't continue use. I couldn't sleep at all, my sex drive completely went away, and worst of all after years of maintaining a healthy weight I gained over 20 lbs. I was always hungry. I figured the weight gain is making my chronic pain worse and just being masked by the drug. I weaned off of my dosage and have been off of it for over two months now. The worst part is the weight I gained isn't even budging no matter how little I eat. It's like it made me more unhealthy than I was to begin with. Not worth it at all; I can't believe the weight isn't even coming off. The pain is of course back but it's not worth the trade.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I have been on duloxetine for over 12 yrs for depression and back pain due to 3 herniated discs, 1 bulging disc and degenerative discs. It has been amazing...except now. I am having pain down my leg from sciatica.   I have worked all my life doing heavy lifting, 8 hours on my feet, bending, straining. What have I done to my back and body after all these years of duloxetine keeping pain at bay??? I am scared to death. I am out of work at the moment cause pain went from back to my toes after doing care on a patient for 2 days.   Waiting for clearance for an MRI.  I am afraid of damage done

Cymbalta (duloxetine):Was prescribed by my rheumatologist to help with pain from ankylosing spondylitis. Took my first pill at 3:30pm, felt terrible by 5pm, had to lay down by 7:30pm feeling generally horrible. At 3 am my husband heard noises and found me unconscious on the hallway floor. It took him awhile to get me to come to and I was very confused and couldn’t speak properly. Took me over a week to feel normal ish again and it turns out I’d had a seizure. Doctor has told me I can never take anything similar again. I’ve also had a blistering rash on my face for over a month now that nothing seems to help.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):Cymbalta changed me from a happy normal person with interests in everything. One shouldn't expect a normal person to have been sleeping away my days, to for one year I dreamed of every person I had ever known. I had repeated dreams, continuing dreams from one night to another. It definitely upset my sleep cycles. I was constantly sleepy tired and had to lay down at any time of the day to sleep for hours. My body wasn’t tired, my brain was affected. I decided to quit cold Turkey and in about two months I started to return to my old self. Stopping the med did no harm to me.  It did not help that much with pain to take Cymbalta. I started to become interested in daily activities again as I used to be. I am happier today even with pain and feel normal once more.

Oh boy. If I had known what my experience off this drug would be like, I wouldn’t have started taking it. My doctor started me on 30 mgs for a week and then told me to go to 60mg if I handled the medicine well. I started taking 60mg and while it helped my migraine some, it didn’t bust them out completely. I’ve taken a few other migraine medications but never liked the drowsiness with them, and I have imitrex for rescue. I took 60 mgs of this medicine for about a month and then put in a refill. My insurance denied it because they’ll only fill 90 day scripts of it now after the initial script. The pharmacy faxed my neurologist twice with NO answer. So I’ve been withdrawing cold turkey off this medicine. I have the worst vertigo, I’m so fatigued. I’ve been so nauseous and haven’t been able to eat much other than eggs and toast without a stomach ache. I have migraines again and I’m stumbling all over the place. Wean off this SLOWLY. This is awful.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I have used Cymbalta for over a year, for IBS pain, joint, back pain and anxiety. Mother was sick and died, I found out I had cancerous nodules in my thyroid and we moved states. I started with 20mg and am at 60mg. Not many side effects when I began,  just some headache. It helped me be calmer, pain relief. At first I lost appetite. But I have been very fatigued, lost emotions, been forgetful, have very vivid dreams and nightmares. I had a complete thyroidectomy, and started to gain weight, even with thyroid supplement. Adding the metabolic change of the drug, and gaining 12 lbs. I decided to wean myself off.  I am hoping to regain some energy, memory, and not want to sleep 12 hrs.   I already feel a little like my old self, more active, as the day goes on and the drug wears off. I don’t relish the return of pain.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I have Trigeminal neuralgia and occipital neuralgia and I took up to 40mg/day in combo with carbamazepine and together they reduced my nerve pain by over 90%. No side effects I can tell. I went down to 30mg and felt no withdrawal.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I was Rx cymbalta for sciatica and periformis pain, but specifically sciatica.  I also have had fibromyalgia for 35 years.. The sciatica pain, which was severe stopped completely in 2 weeks.  I continued taking cymbalta 4-5 mos then decided I would discontinue it because I do not favor being drug dependent.  All was well for 2-3 days other than headaches upon awakening. They went away after a cup of coffee. On day 4 I noticed I was a bit frustrated and forgetful.  Did not relate it to Cymbalta.  By day 5 my sciatica pain had returned along with muscular pain all over my body! I could not get to a tub of very hot water fast enough!  I am very body aware so I cancelled 2 Christmas parties and restarted cymbalta.  Let's see if cymbalta can recover me!

Spine clinic doctor prescribed for pain in my lower spine (Compressed L4 & L5).  Pain into my right buttock,  and radiating down the outside of my right leg. Using a cane to walk.  Duloxetine 40 mg 2x/day, plus 600 mg 3x/day  of Gabapentin.  Been taking these for about 4 months. So far,  barely relieves the pain. I have a side effect of short term memory, which I did not have before using one or both of  these drugs.  I am considering a change due to memory problem which I had not had before.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):Prescribed for nerve pain in my ear and face post Shingles. Already on 4 other medications that effect Serotonin, but given regardless. PVC's started 8 hours after first 30mg dose. (Ectopic Heart Beats) Continued with medication for 7 days before ceasing with no tapering.PVC's continue still, 8-9 a minute.2 Emergency Hospital Visits when my abnormal heart rhythm started to cause crushing pain. Prescribed Celebrex for inflammation of the heart.Pain has ceased. PVC's Continue.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):If you are seeking treatment for chronic pain, anxiety, & depression as a person with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, especially if you also have temperature or orthostatic intolerance or other dysautonomic symptoms.. DO NOT TAKE THIS. I started at 30mg and increased all the way to 120mg (then decreased back down to 60mg and eventually weaned off). I noticed no change to my pain levels. I did experience an increase in energy - but not a positive one - I experienced insomnia, tachycardia, & extremely severe anxiety. I did a lot of risk taking while on this medication, & increasingly wished I was never born. Lost my appetite entirely & lost 20-25% of my body weight. The sweating was unbearable. Between the malnutrition & the nightmares I managed to chip two teeth by grinding them in the few hours I was able to sleep. I may have bone loss as well. It made me very dizzy with the underlying POTS and I now require beta blockers twice daily to manage my heart rate despite cessation of Cymbalta use.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):The worst experience of my life!!! 6 days on 30mg.  Hallucinations, could barely stand on my own so weak ended up in E.DI have Parkinson's  and thought this was the end!I have been through a lot in my life ,32 surgeriesMetastatic Cancer.  This was one of the scariest things I and my wife have gone through.  I wish I had never taken this stuff!

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I was prescribed Cymbalta to help with the chronic pain I have from a rare vascular syndrome and have had many surgeries but it has left me with left flank and left leg pain. I took a 30mg pill at 10pm. and woke up to the room spinning, I began vomiting, my stomach was aching, my vision was so blurred, I suffered all day and things started to subside that evening, the next morning my vision is still blurry! It was like poison in my body!!!And that was one pill!!!!!!
Avoid it at all cost. I don't know how it is still on the market.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I was on this medication for almost two years for chronic pain related to EDS before I realized how poorly it was managing my pain yet messing up my life. Some side effects never went away like sleep problems which required more medications to manage. Also had significant personal relationship problems. Fired my doctor and quit the medication three weeks ago and withdraw is almost gone away. Already feel clearer in the head than I have for years yet pain is about the same.  BEWARE of this drug and doctors that push it!

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I have been on Cymbalta for about 1 month.  The first week or so 20mg, 40 mg thereafter.  I have spondylolisthesis with radialcupathy (pain in hip going down my leg).  It is helping me so much.  I can take walks and sleep in bed again.   I have had some extensive dreaming, insomnia,  eye irritation and headaches.  Most side effects have quit except for headache.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I tried Cymbalta about a year ago and had some pretty bad side effects. After reading the bad reviews I quit taking it after about a week. My anxiety, depression etc only got worse as the year went on. I was having intense tension headaches on a daily basis for 3 years. My whole body was plagued with pain to the point I could barely get out of bed. I just assumed it was arthritis and I would have to live with it. I’m 55 years old , run my own business  with nearly a 1000 customers and the anxiety was about to get the best of me. If you are still reading DO NOT let the negativity change your mind. I stuck it out this time and this has been a life saver. Headaches, gone! Most of the pain, gone! Getting my life back . It feels good to feel good. Anxiety is all but gone too! It’s only been 2 months now at 60 mg but so far so good. There is hope my friends. Just find what works for you. I gave it a nine because I didn’t sleep for nearly 5 days but worth it all right now.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):Life-changing for my chronic pain and PTSD. Within the first day it majorly improved my mood and I no longer felt like I had to be ready for a fight every time I went out. 12 years of severe psychosomatic chronic pain gone. It also stopped my lucid nightmares and allows me to breathe deeply (might sound a bit weird but previously my breaths never felt like I got enough oxygen).  Only side effects at first included lethargy, clammy hands and tummy aches if I didn’t take it with food.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I have suffered frequent, significant chronic neurological pain in my head, neck, and face forbears. After a difficult starting to the medicine (about 3 months), the side effects subsided.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):Well I just started taking it and it helps because I was in so much pain it helps a lot every time I say thank you for it because my body was always in pain. So yes I feel 20 percent better and yes I am going to keep taking them every one is different

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I was given cymbalta 30mg for pain, I took one pill, I have been so ill, terrible migraine, twitching, my blood pressure went up to 180 over 90, it affected my whole body, this is the 3rd day  after taking it and still feel very weak, how can one pill cause a person to feel that ill, I had concussion 18 months ago, so maybe that has something to do with it?, as still in pain with my head. This drug is terrible.

Please do not try or thinking of taking this meds. It’s not worth it. Prescribed 30mg from the doctor and took it the first night. Please stay away from this nightmare of a drug and shame on doctors for not warning people about the withdrawal you may experience coming off of it.

I was given this medication for severe nerve pain and neuropathy. I also happened to be going through menopause. Cymbalta (duloxetine):Marvellous tablet has helped with chronic back pain. I have major depression also/anxietyIt helps with all 3 . The pain still is slightly there but it’s certainly helped  able to sleep betterEvery body is different I guess what works for one may not work for another. I have on many antidepressants and this one I have to rate the highest.

Cymbalta (duloxetine):Cymbalta is one truely awful drug which has caused side effects of muscle and nerve damage to my legs. Cymbalta (duloxetine):Cymbalta Day 2: 8 am and 30 mg dose and the effect: dizziness today and the clarity is there...that usual feeling I had at 10 am and wanting to dig a hole and hide so I could self soothe my pain was gone so that it didn't happen. After two years in almost constant pain with multiple herniated discs and spinal cyst at L4/L5 I was put on waiting list for decompression surgery. I cannot take NSAIDs and literally no pain relief from opiates or anything else they could give me. I was pretty desperate and had constant sciatica. My doctor suggested Duloxetine - starting on 20mg once a day. Over 2 months to get to 60mg once a day but once they started working I have gone from a pain level 8-9 down to 2 and under. Sometimes no pain at all! If you go up slowly in dosage the side effects are minimal. I am considering not having the surgery and keeping on Duloxetine as they also have helped with keeping my menopausal moods more stable. I hope they work for anyone in a similar position - my Mum is now finding relief on them for neuropathic pain as well

Cymbalta (duloxetine):I've been on Cymbalta for about a month now for lack of energy, depression and chronic back pain. I started with 30mg/D and one week later to 60mg/D. I had some mild nausea a few days after starting the 30mg and nothing at all with 60. This medication is changing my life and is doing everything it's supposed to do. The back pain is gone almost completely, I'm energized, focused and calm. I can now put in a full productive day just like everyone else and not be dragging myself around by noon. I was very scared to start because I read all the scary reviews but I love, love, love this stuff!

I am 41 years old. Once I turned 39 years old, all the injuries and surgeries finally caught up with me causing me pain. I just started Duloxetine, and so far I'm very impressed. This medication, so far, has eliminated my aches and pains and boosted my moods in a positive way.

I feel mental clarity and the constant irritability from chronic pain was completely relieved. I wish I had tried this years ago! I realize not everyone has the same experience with medications but my quality of life has increased significantly! I have nerve pain that has almost totally gone away!

I was assaulted and strangled May 2020, which left me with the feeling of losing myself. Cymbalta (duloxetine):I have been on Cymbalta for 3 weeks  and feel great — free of spine pain and aches that follow surgeries. No longer am I taking pain meds or high doses of aspirin. Keep pinching myself that this is real!
